sect1.title: Betweenness / Degree Centrality
sect1.para:
Betweenness is a centrality measure of a node within a graph. A score for this betweenness is computed using the algorithm presented in the following
publication
by Ulrik Brandes.

Betweenness is represented by the colour of concepts while degree is represented by their size. The colour legend used for betweenness centrality is based on the colours of the rainbow (purple = minimum, indigo, blue, green, yellow, orange, red = maximum).
